contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=February 2009}} {{Infobox President |honorific-prefix = [[The Right Honourable]] |name = Veerasamy Ringadoo<br> வீரசாமி ரிங்காடு<br> सर वीरसम्य रिन्गदू |image = Veerasamy Ringadoo.jpg |imagesize = 150px |honorific-suffix = [[Queen's Counsel|QC]], [[Order of St Michael and St George|GCMG]], [[Order of the Star and Key of the Indian Ocean|GCSK]] , |order = [[List of Presidents of Mauritius|President of Mauritius]] |primeminister = [[Anerood Jugnauth]] |vicepresident = Vacant |term_start = 12 March 1992 |term_end = 30 June 1992 |predecessor = Office established |successor = [[Cassam Uteem]] |order2 = [[List of Governors-General of Mauritius|Governor General of Mauritius]] |monarch2 = [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|Elizabeth II]] |primeminister2 = [[Anerood Jugnauth]] |term_start2 = 17 January 1986 |term_end2 = 12 March 1992 |predecessor2 = [[Seewoosagur Ramgoolam]] |successor2 = Office abolished |birth_date = 20 October 1920 |birth_place = [[Port Louis, Mauritius]]<ref>[http://books.google.ca/books?id=kPbSAAAAMAAJ&q=Veerasamy+Ringadoo+1920&dq=Veerasamy+Ringadoo+1920&hl=en&sa=X&ei=MtALT7WhDIWwiQKo0umbBA&ved=0CFUQ6AEwBw]</ref> |death_date = {{Death date and age|df=y|2000|9|9|1920|10|20}} |death_place = }} Sir '''Veerasamy Ringadoo''', [[Order of St Michael and St George|GCMG]], [[Order of the Star and Key of the Indian Ocean|GCSK]], [[Queen's Counsel|QC]], (born வீரசாமி ரிங்காடு; 20 October 1920 – 9 September 2000) was the [[List of Governors-General of Mauritius|Governor General]] of [[Mauritius]] from 17 January 1986 to 12 March 1992, when it became a republic. Ringadoo then served as [[President of Mauritius|President]] until later in 1992, when he was replaced by the democratically elected Cassam Uteem. He is a [[Tamil people|Tamil]] by origin and a [[Hindu]].<ref>http://www.country-data.com/cgi-bin/query/r-8639.html</ref> He was a founder of ''[http://www.webofmauritius.com/tamilleague/history.htm League of Tamils]'' in 1937.<ref>http://www.webofmauritius.com/tamilleague/history.htm</ref> As Finance Minister of Mauritius, Ringadoo was knighted in the 1975 New Year Honours List,<ref>[http://www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/46447/supplements/41 London Gazette, 1 January 1975]</ref> and following his appointment as Governor-General, appointed a Knight Grand Cross of the Order of St. Michael and St. George in June 1986.<ref>[http://www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/50547/pages/7729 London Gazette, 10 June 1986]</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-gov}} {{Succession box |title = [[List of Governors-General of Mauritius|Governor-General of Mauritius]] |before = [[Seewoosagur Ramgoolam]] |after = Office abolished |years = 1986 – 1992 }} {{s-off}} {{Succession box |title = [[President of the Republic of Mauritius|President of Mauritius]] |before = Office established |after = [[Cassam Uteem]] |years = 1992 }} {{s-end}} {{MauritiusPres}} {{Authority control|VIAF=32916154}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Ringadoo, Veersamy | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Governor-General of Mauritius | DATE OF BIRTH = 20 October 1920 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Port Louis, Mauritius]] | DATE OF DEATH =9 September 2000 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ringadoo, Veersamy}} [[Category:1920 births]] [[Category:2000 deaths]] [[Category:Presidents of Mauritius]] [[Category:Governors-General of Mauritius]] [[Category:Knights Grand Cross of the Order of St Michael and St George]] [[Category:Knights Bachelor]] [[Category:Mauritian Hindus]] [[Category:Mauritius Tamil politicians]] [[Category:Mauritian people of Indian descent]] [[Category:Mauritian people of Tamil descent]] {{Mauritius-politician-stub}}
